(Simplified: 橼)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 緣 indicates the sound; 木 (tree) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 緣 [ yuán ] reason, cause; fate; margin, hem

櫞字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　櫞； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页560第29
【唐韻】與專切【集韻】【韻會】余專切，?音緣。【唐韻】枸櫞，皮可爲椶。出交趾。　又【埤雅】果名，似橘。【南方草木狀】枸櫞，子肉甚厚，白如蘆菔，女工競雕鏤花草，漬以蜂蜜。亦名香櫞。【異物志】味不美，可浣治葛苧。【學圃餘疏】香櫞花酷烈甚於山礬，結實大而香。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　橼; Kangxi Strokes: 19; Page Number: Page 560 29
【Tang Yun】and special cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] I special cut,? Sound fate. [Tang Yun] Citron, the skin can be stubborn. Intercourse toe.　[Piya] The name of the fruit is like an orange. [Southern vegetation-like] Citrus, thick flesh, white like reeds, female workers compete to carve flowers and plants, stained with honey. Also known as citron. [Foreign Body History] The taste is not good, you can cure Ge Zhu. 【Study Garden Yushu】The citron flower is more intense than the viburnum, strong, big and fragrant.
